text: hi I am Central Nagaraj i'm a partner
solutions architect at AWS
hi I'm Jose Rodriguez i'm a product
architect at IBM focus on identity
access management today we will talk
about IBM verify and how it integrates
with AWS AM identity center first I want
to talk about AWS IM identity center
it is a fully managed service on AWS
that gives customers the ability to
efficiently manage access to
applications across their enterprise
this includes AI applications such as
Amazon Q developer and you can do this
across multiple AWS accounts in your
organization as your business grows as
is with all AWS services AWS IM identity
center lets you scale the access to your
applications and AWS services securely
it also allows you to share identities
across applications and across your AWS
accounts customers are in full control
of what information is shared between
these applications and these AWS
accounts before we get into the
nitty-gritty of the integration Jose can
you paint a picture describing the lay
of the land sure many customers are
building new applications or modernizing
existing applications to run on the
cloud using AWS typically these
applications will consume many of the
infrastructure services provided by AWS
one of the major challenges that
customers face is how to properly secure
access to AWS resources used by the
applications customers must consider the
various user populations that have a
business need to access such resources
great in what ways can IBM Verify help
our customers secure access to their AWS
resources
yeah IBM security verify provides
advanced authentication mechanisms
including uh the ability to adopt
fishing resistant authentication
mechanisms like pass keys it integrates
using single signon protocols and
multiffactor authentication which
ensures that user access to the AWS
environments through a secure unified
login experience ibm verify also
incorporates risk based authentication
to evaluate the risk level of the user
login attempt by analyzing factors like
device location and behavior and it
adjusts the authentication requirements
dynamically to mitigate any potential
threats to supports governance and life
cycle management ensuring that
identities are properly managed and
access rights are granted and revoked at
the right times thanks now can you
explain the integration between IBM
security verify and AWS IM identity
center of course here's a diagram
showing the
integration ibm verify use in uh
collaboration with AWS IMD center it
provides a comprehensive identity and
access management solution for
organizations using AWS services
aws IM identity center manages
permission across various AWS services
such as Amazon EC2 compute services
Amazon S3 storage services Amazon Aurora
database services Amazon API gateway
among other things these services allow
users to perform various operations such
as start stop create delete get update
those resources depending on the
assigned permissions
amazon IM identity center also exposes a
user life cycle management endpoint that
using the skin protocol to be able to
manage the permissions associated with
those uh identities ibm verify SAS
provides the ability to organize all the
AWS permissions on application roles
providing a mechanism to assign the
right permissions on AWS according to
the roles and responsibilities of the
type of users that are represented in
the platform great Jose you provided an
amazing explanation of the integrations
and how customers can use it but what
are the benefits of these integrations
to our customers yeah so this seamless
integration ensures that organizations
can protect identities can enforce
granular permissions and can streamline
access to AWS resources while adhering
to the uh security best practice support
for fishing resistant mechanisms to
authenticate the user adaptive access
enforcement and MFA to properly
authenticate the user accessing AWS
resources
um it also provides the ability to
properly manage uh the permissions of
users to access AWS resources when they
join move or leave an organization it's
a way to guarantee that users only have
the least amount of permissions that are
uh required to accomplish their role it
also provides a mechanism to detect and
remediate any out of process changes
that improperly assign permissions to a
user bypassing any security controls
that the enterprise has and it lastly
provides a mechanism to uh proactively
certify the business needs to maintain
access to those AWS resources by
applying certification campaigns
great thanks for sharing how IBM verify
SAS integrates with AWS IM identity
center jose
uh thank you Santiel and I also want to
